intro: Luziola bahiensis var. alabamensis, commonly known as the Alabama bluemink, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and swampy areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a bluish hue, while its small white flowers bloom in clusters. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several states.
